meanings.definition: A small spinning wheel used for spinning cotton or other fibers into thread.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother showed me how to use the charkha to spin cotton into thread.
meanings.sent2: The charkha in the corner of the room was a family heirloom.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to play with the charkha, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved swiftly on the charkha, turning fluff into gold.
meanings.sent5: The charkha hummed softly as it transformed fibers into yarn.

meanings.definition: To spin cotton or other fibers into thread using a charkha.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to charkha from my mother, who learned it from her mother.
meanings.sent2: She charkhaed the cotton with skill, creating fine threads for weaving.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched their teacher try to charkha during the craft class.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to charkha a tale of mystery and intrigue.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of charkhaing filled the room, calming everyone around.
